basic_info.description: Hello, my name is Kai-Jen and I am a master student at the University of Washington studying Electrical Engineering. I am a skilled software developer with experience in C++, Python, Rust, Java, and Javascript. I am currently taking courses in computer networks and distributed systems, and have begun a project on cybersecurity sandboxing. As a student and a developer, I am passionate about technology and its potential to change the world. I am eager to apply my skills and knowledge in a software engineering internship for the summer of 2023. Thank you for visiting my profile.

experience.title: Data Engineer
description: Revamped internal website in cooperation with teammates to facilitate pipeline jobs monitoring (Python, Flask, HTML, CSS)
Resolved complex technical issue that blocked production deployment
Built an internal website for monitoring Hadoop cluster machines health status and managing nodes (JavaScript, CSS, HTML, Node.js, Kubernetes)
Communicated with data scientists to solve ad hoc data pipeline issues
Developed new tools to assist data scientists and product teams operate more efficiently and reduce data processing time (Python)
Established an Airflow alert system to monitor the quality of data and failures, making the debugging process easier (Airflow, Python)

experience.title: Backend Engineer
description: Built an efficient, extendable data processing pipeline for machine learning model with multi-thread technique, which can process tens of millions of data simultaneously (Rust)
Assisted with the development and implementation of systems that allow traders to process massive amounts of data (Rust)
Cooperated with traders and developed tools to quickly process and analyze large amount of data (Rust)

experience.title: Quantitative Analyst
description: Developed automated tool to analyze tens of thousands of trading data (Python)
Developed trading methods using statistical and machine learning models (Python, Scikit-learn)
Collected and transformed market data to aid discretionary trading (Python)
